title: Police violence
description:
thursday night 27th of august and friday morning 28th of august, the following happened to me and my friend in berlin: around 2 am we were drinking our final beer on heinrichplatz (kreuzberg) and witnessed the police control of a black person and decided to go nearer to offer the person some social control. my friend started filming with her phone and my other friend tried but couldn´t because her phone didn´t have enough memory. the police tried to stop us from filming and one police officer took my friends phone and deleted the videos, the phone was given back to her. the phone of my other friend however, they wanted to confiscate because they believed she filmed something and immediately put it online. this was not the case, in fact she did not film at all. in the meantime, the police officers had called for back up and there were 8 (!) police cars in total with 16 police officers called to deal with this. my friend and me got into a discussion with the police, we told them we could show them on the phone that she did not film anything, so we could go home with the phone. they didn´t accept this and really wanted to have the phone. they told me to step back, because they wanted to talk to her alone. i said i would stay by her side. all of a sudden they ripped us apart and threw me on the ground and put me in handcuffs behind my back. my other friend was filming everything, but the police tried to block the camera and shine their lights into it. they took her phone and put me against the car. i was yelling to my other friend on the other side of the street and the police officer told me that i could only speak german so they could understand (my friend doesn´t understand german), i ignored this order and continued to speak in dutch. the police officer said to her colleague that i was annoying and that she wanted to put me in the car and take me with them. i was put in the car with a police officer guarding me. meanwhile, 8 police cars with sirens were blocking the whole street for this ´incident.

in the car i started crying and they began to mock me -she´s a cry baby- or -what the hell is wrong with her- and laughing at me. they took me to Polizeidirektion Abschnitt 5 in Friedrichshain. when we arrived they put me on a chair still handcuffed. it was around 3 am now. my crying became a panic attack and the police officers started mocking me even more. they took me to another room where the policeman who arrested me was typing out the case. i asked to read the statement and make my own statement but they never let me read anything, they never took my statement. when i asked why i was arrested, they told me it was because of -Versuchte Körperverletzung von Polizisten und Widerstand gegen Vollstreckungsbeamte- so they said i tried to hurt police officers and resisting police. ofcourse i was the one that was hurt: my head and the whole left side of my body hit the ground when they threw me on the floor, my knees where hurt when they turned me around and pressed me on the floor. 

because i don´t live in berlin (i live in belgium), they could not let me go, they said, there  was a danger that i would ´run´. so they decided they would put me in a cell. around 8 am they took me to LKA Berlin (Landeskriminalamt Berlin) at tempelhof to the department 5, for terrorists and people that commit severe felonies such as sex crimes and abduction etc. on my arrival there they treated me like a dog. i was still crying and they were humiliating me even more. two women took me to a very small room where they left me for a while (i was having a second panic attack here). they came back and told me to take off my clothes, they took my belongings, looked at my whole body and humiliated me by looking if i had hidden something in my ass or vagina. when they saw i had a tampon, they told me to put my clothes back on. my pullover and jacket were taken, they promised they would give me a pullover (which they never did). other police officers took me to a tiny stinking cell with a `bed´ made out of wooden planks impossible to sleep on. they left me there for another 4 hours. i was thirsty and cold, since 2 am they refused to give me water and they refused to give me something to wear or a blanket. 

around 12 am on friday, they took me out of the cell, took fingerprints, made mugshots, documented all the details of my looks and gave me back my belongings. i asked why they put me in the cell, why they arrested me and if i could see the statement they made. they said if i want to know anything or see any document i have to get a lawyer and they threw me out.

Luckily she got out safely, found us and explained us everything. She was obviously shook and went home, where she promptly passed out and got found by her mother. 

She had explained to me what the dude had looked like, so I was already furious and on high alert (didn\'t know about the drugging part yet, was still at said party) - not much later I felt someone randomly grab my ass. I turned around and saw that this dude completely fit the description. 
I got all up in his face yelling at him (overprotectiveness over a friend + alcohol will make me disregard my own safety sometimes). He started yelling back, he was a very buff and toxic dude, I almost hit him and my friend had to drag me away. 

When \"cooling down\" in the girl\'s bathroom, a random girl came up to me and told me \"I know this dude. He\'s very dangerous. Stay away from him.\"

Didn\'t see him after that, and we were all obviously very shook about all the events of that evening.

Ondanks de stappen die ik al ondernomen heb, blijf ik nog steeds achter met het gevoel dat het allemaal taboe is. Maar ik zit er behoorlijk mee.
Het doel dat ik hiermee hoop te bereiken is dat mensen er toch een keer bij stil kunnen staan dat het ook in een parkt achter de muren kan gebeuren van een club waar iedereen bevriend zou moeten zijn met elkaar. Maar dan voor mij nog op een moment dat ik het toch nog stiekem en rustig aan kan aanpakken.
De meest ideale situatie voor mij zou zijn dat de zin geplaatst word voor de deur van het powerlokaal van de atletiek club olse merksen. (als dit mag uiteraard)

description:

At the intersection of the Carrefour Express, he joined another group of people and we thought we would stop. Instead of that, he came back to us to continue harassing us. I asked a man in a bike that was passing by and two more girls that were in a group around to help us. He felt intimidated and ran away. 
Then I went to the Police to make a complaint. Apparently, currently, there is not a specific protocol to attend to victims of this kind of violence. As a woman from Latinamerica that came to this country to study, I do not feel safe anymore in the streets of Leuven. Being drunk is not a justification for this kind of aggression. title: Hij wou mij \'naar huis brengen\'.
description:
Meisjes mogen toch ook drinken? 
Een \'kennis\' van op het skatepark wou mij na een avondje drinken in het park naar huis begeleiden. Ik had veel gedronken maar ik vermoed dat iemand mijn drankje gespiket had. De kerel kwam binnen en maakte goed gebruik van de situatie. Ik werd verdwaasd wakker in mijn bed. Overal bloed. In de badkamer, op het bed, op de vloer, ook op het hoofdkussen dat hij onder me geschoven had, omdat ik duidelijk niet kon meewerken. Ik deed aangifte bij de politie, maar daar kon ik niet op veel hulp rekenen. “Geen getuigen”, “onvoldoende bewijs”. Nadien maakte de dader een groepschat en hebben die heren onderling eens besproken wat ze konden doen om hem te helpen. Genieten achteraf, wanneer ik te weten kwam dat de helft van de Gentse skatescene wist wat er met mij gebeurd was en mij niet gelooft, of sterker nog: de kant van mijn verkrachter kiest. De jongens in kwestie: 1 werkt bij VZW Jong als jeugdbegeleider, 1 publiceerde onlangs een boek met mentale gezondheid als sleutelonderwerp, nog 1 heeft een aantal skateshops in Vlaanderen, de rest bekende skaters. Ja, deze lieve jongens nemen het graag op voor hun maatje. Besef wat zij gedaan hebben, waar zij aan meewerken! En maar beweren dat vrouwen veilig zijn op het skatepark. “Girl-events” organiseren, nee dankjewel! Ik griezel hiervan. Dit heeft mijn vertrouwen in mannen ernstig aangetast. Mijn gevoel op een skatepark zal nooit meer hetzelfde zijn. Nog een dader die zijn handjes mag kussen. Laat dit niet gebeuren. Speak up. & Boys, do right by the women in your life.
